summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Martin Weinberg and Assistant U.S. Attorney Mike regarding the availability of original documents and attached passport photographs in the case U.S. v. Epstein. The AUSA confirms photographs are attached and notes that pages 6 and 7 were blank and not photographed.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Defense attorney emailing about seeing original documents in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Mike
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney who sent attached passport photographs and explained that pages 6-7 were blank.

connections.description: Correspondence between defense attorney and prosecutor regarding case documents and evidence.

events.title: Email exchange about Epstein case documents
events.description: Email correspondence regarding the availability of original documents and attached passport photographs in U.S. v. Epstein case.

keyFacts: Email exchange shows ongoing legal proceedings in U.S. v. Epstein case in July 2019.
Passport photographs were requested and provided as part of case evidence.
Pages 6 and 7 of the photographed documents were blank and not included.
Communication between defense attorney Martin Weinberg and prosecutor Mike about document review.
